Class DEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.commons.hierarchy.Entry

    FileWrapper

    public class DEntry
extends Entry
    Represents a directory entry.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DEntry

        public DEntry(java.io.File underlyingFile)
        Creates a file entry for the given file.

        This can be used if the hierarchy is already built and there is need to load an already known file.

        Parameters:
        underlyingFile - the file
        See Also:
        DEntry(String), Entry.initForParent(File)

      • DEntry

        public DEntry(java.lang.String entryName)
        Creates a directory entry for the given entry name without children.
        Parameters:
        entryName - the directory name (not the path, just the name)
        See Also:
        DEntry(String, Entry...), createNormalizedHierarchyForPath(String, String, Entry...)

      • DEntry

        public DEntry(java.lang.String entryName,
              Entry... entries)
        Creates a directory entry for the given entry name initialized with the given children.

        Note that the added entries are not automatically normalized, but this must be done manually invoking normalizeHierarchy().

        Parameters:
        entryName - the directory name (not the path, just the name)
        entries - the entries this directory entry is initialized within it
        See Also:
        createNormalizedHierarchyForPath(String, String, Entry...)

    • Method Detail

      • createNormalizedHierarchyForPath

        public static DEntry createNormalizedHierarchyForPath(java.lang.String systemPath,
                                                      java.lang.String entryName,
                                                      Entry... entries)
        Creates a dentry for the given entry name using the given system path as base directory and initializes it with the given entries.

        The directory is normalized: every entry is recursively initialized consistently with the given system path.

        Parameters:
        systemPath - the relative or absolute system path that proceed the entry name
        entryName - the entry name
        entries - the entries this dentry is initialized inside it
        Returns:
        a dentry already normalized for the given paths.
        See Also:
        DEntry(String, Entry...), normalizeHierarchy()

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(Entry entry)
        Adds an entry to the entries inside this directory and normalizes it.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to name
        See Also:
        addEntry(Entry, boolean)

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(Entry entry,
                     boolean andNormalize)
        Adds an entry to the entries inside this directory entry and optionally normalize the nested entries using this directory entry as parent for make those consistent.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to name
        andNormalize - whether the entry should be normalized against this directory entry as it parent
        See Also:
        addEntry(Entry)

      • getEntries

        public java.util.Collection<Entry> getEntries()
        Returns the children of this directory entry.
        Returns:
        the entries of this entry.

      • getEntry

        public Entry getEntry(java.lang.String entryName)
        Returns an (the) entry that matches the given entry name.
        Parameters:
        entryName - the entry name to find
        Returns:
        the entry that matches the given entry name if exists, or null otherwise
        See Also:
        getFEntry(String), getDEntry(String)

      • getFEntry

        public FEntry getFEntry(java.lang.String entryName)
        Returns an (the) entry that matches the given entry name and that is an FEntry. If an entry exists but is not an FEntry, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        entryName - the entry name to find
        Returns:
        the entry that matches the given entry name if exists, or null otherwise
        See Also:
        getEntry(String), getDEntry(String)

      • getDEntry

        public DEntry getDEntry(java.lang.String entryName)
        Returns an (the) entry that matches the given entry name and that is an DEntry. If an entry exists but is not an DEntry, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        entryName - the entry name to find
        Returns:
        the entry that matches the given entry name if exists, or null otherwise
        See Also:
        getEntry(String), getFEntry(String)

      • containsEntry

        public boolean containsEntry(java.lang.String entryName)
        Returns whether the entry with the given entry name exists within this entry children.
        Parameters:
        entryName - the entry name to find
        Returns:
        whether the entry exists

      • normalizeHierarchy

        public void normalizeHierarchy()
        Normalizes this directory entry and every nested entry inside it recursively.

        The normalization process essentially initializes the underlying file of the entry using the parent entry as parent directory for figure out its path.

        Note that for make the process work, the root entry this method is called from must have a valid system path as entry name.

      • create

        public boolean create()
        Description copied from class: Entry
        Creates the underlying file this entry wraps.
        Specified by:
        create in class Entry
        Returns:
        whether the creation has been successful.

      • loadChildren

        public void loadChildren()
        Loads the nested files of this directory into the children list and continues the process recursively.

        This entry should be normalized with normalizeHierarchy() before using this method.
